alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Mendocino Interior; Northern Lake County; Northwestern Mendocino Interior; Southern Humboldt Interior; Southern Lake County; Southwestern Humboldt (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 04 at 2:34PM PST until March 05 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 1000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 1000 feet. Total snow accumulations ranging from 7 inches near 1000 feet to 17 inches across higher ridges. Snow may accumulate at elevations below 1000 feet in northern Mendocino and interior Humboldt counties. Snow levels may be closer to 1500 feet in Lake County. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph on ridgetops. * WHERE...Portions of northwest California. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state of California can be obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.
